learning_objective: Describe how internal and external parts of computing devices function to form a system.
topic: Islamic Golden Age and Scientific Advancements
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex has been studying the Islamic Golden Age and its scientific advancements, particularly the invention of the astrolabe. The astrolabe, a device used to solve problems related to time and the position of the stars, has multiple rotating parts each playing a specific role. Similarly, a computer also has many internal and external parts that function together to form a system. Which part of the computer is similar to the rotating parts of the astrolabe that use data to solve calculations?",
    "Answer1": "The Central Processing Unit (CPU)",
    "Answer2": "The Solid-State Drive (SSD)",
    "Answer3": "The RAM (Random Access Memory)",
    "Answer4": "The Wi-Fi Card",
    "CorrectAnswer": "1",
    "Explanation": "The Central Processing Unit (CPU), similar to the rotating parts of the astrolabe, performs most calculations within a computer. Like how the rotating parts of the astrolabe use data to solve calculations, the CPU processes instructions to solve tasks."
}
